relation: configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
router bgp autonomous-system-number Example: Device(config)# router bgp 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} remote-as as-number Example: Device(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 remote-as 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} update-source interface-type interface-number Example: Device(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 update-source Loopback 0
address-family ipv4 [mdt | multicast | tunnel | unicast [vrf vrf-name] | vrf vrf-name] Example: Device(config-router)# address-family ipv4
neighbor {ip-address | peer-group-name | ipv6-address} activate Example: Device(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 activate
neighbor { ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} send-label Example: Device(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.102 send-label
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Adds an entry to the multiprotocol BGP neighbor table for peering with the ASBR1.
Enables the BGP session to use a source address on the specified interface.
Enters address family configuration mode to configure a routing session using standard IPv4 address prefixes.
Enables the exchange of information for this address family with the specified BGP neighbor.
Enables label exchange for this address family to this neighbor in order to receive the remote PE IPv4 loopback with the label set to an end-to-end LSP.
pageTitle: IPv6 Implementation Guide, Cisco IOS Release 15.2M&T - Implementing IPv6 VPN over MPLS [Cisco IOS 15.2M&T] - Cisco

textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 9.    exit 8.    neighbor { ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} send-label 7.    neighbor {ip-address | peer-group-name | ipv6-address} activate 6.    address-family ipv4 [mdt | multicast | tunnel | unicast [vrf vrf-name] | vrf vrf-name] 5.    neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} update-source interface-type interface-number 4.    neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} remote-as as-number 3.    router bgp autonomous-system-number 2.    configure terminal
textAfterTable: Configuring Peering to Another ISP Route Reflector Perform this task to configure peering to an ISP route reflector named RR2. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    router bgp autonomous-system-number 4.    neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} remote-as as-number 5.    neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} update-source interface-type interface-number 6.    neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address| peer-group-name} ebgp-multihop [ttl] 7.    address-family vpnv6 [unicast] 8.    neighbor {ip-address | peer-group-name | ipv6-address} activate 9.
